activities.name: Select Tables That Require Masking
activities.description: Select tables with a data mapping and assigned algorithms, as well as filters that may be needed for conditional masking.

sqlReaderQuery.value:
WITH
tables_requiring_filters AS
(
    SELECT DISTINCT
        dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
    FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
    WHERE ISJSON(assigned_algorithm) = 1
    AND dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
    AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CONTAINER}'
    AND specified_schema LIKE '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_DIRECTORY}%'
),
tables_not_requiring_filters AS
(
    SELECT DISTINCT
        dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
    FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
    WHERE assigned_algorithm IS NOT NULL
    AND assigned_algorithm != ''
    AND dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
    AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CONTAINER}'
    AND specified_schema LIKE '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_DIRECTORY}%'
    EXCEPT
    SELECT dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
    FROM tables_requiring_filters
    WHERE dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
    AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CONTAINER}'
    AND specified_schema LIKE '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_DIRECTORY}%'
),
all_filters AS
(
    SELECT DISTINCT
        JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.alias') as filter_alias,
        replace(JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.condition'), '@{variables('CONDITIONAL_MASKING_RESERVED_CHARACTER')}', concat('byName(''', d.identified_column, ''') ')) as filter_value
    FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d 
        CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
    WHERE
        ISJSON(assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
        AND
        identified_table in (
            SELECT identified_table FROM tables_requiring_filters
        )
        AND JSON_VALUE(kc.value,'$.alias') != 'default'
    UNION
    SELECT DISTINCT
        'default' as filter_alias,
        STRING_AGG(concat('not(', replace(JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.condition'), '@{variables('CONDITIONAL_MASKING_RESERVED_CHARACTER')}', concat('byName(''', d.identified_column, ''')')),')'), ' && ') as filter_value
    FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d 
        CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
    WHERE
        ISJSON(assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
        AND
        identified_table in (
            SELECT identified_table FROM tables_requiring_filters
        )
        AND JSON_VALUE(kc.value,'$.alias') != 'default'
), sources_and_filters AS (
    SELECT
        dataset,
        specified_database,
        specified_schema,
        identified_table,
        filter_alias,
        filter_value
    FROM tables_requiring_filters CROSS JOIN all_filters
    UNION
    SELECT
        dataset,
        specified_database,
        specified_schema,
        identified_table,
        '',
        ''
    FROM tables_not_requiring_filters
)
SELECT DISTINCT
	dm.source_dataset,
	dm.source_database,
	dm.source_schema,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.source_schema), CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.source_schema)), LEN(dm.source_schema))) AS source_directory,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.source_schema),0, CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.source_schema)))) AS source_prefix,
	dm.source_table,
	dm.sink_dataset,
	dm.sink_database,
	dm.sink_schema,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.sink_schema), CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.sink_schema)), LEN(dm.sink_schema))) AS sink_directory,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.source_schema),0, CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.source_schema)))) AS sink_prefix,
	dm.sink_table,
	rs.filter_alias,
	rs.filter_value
FROM
	sources_and_filters rs
	JOIN @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')} dm
	ON (
		rs.dataset = dm.source_dataset AND
		rs.specified_database = dm.source_database AND
		rs.specified_schema = dm.source_schema AND
		rs.identified_table = dm.source_table
	)
WHERE
	dm.sink_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SINK_CONTAINER}'
    AND dm.sink_schema LIKE '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SINK_DIRECTORY}/%'
	AND (dm.mapping_complete IS NULL OR dm.mapping_complete = 0)
	AND (ISJSON(dm.masked_status) = 0  OR dm.masked_status IS NULL)
UNION
SELECT DISTINCT
	dm.source_dataset,
	dm.source_database,
	dm.source_schema,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.source_schema), CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.source_schema)), LEN(dm.source_schema))) AS source_directory,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.source_schema),0, CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.source_schema)))) AS source_prefix,
	dm.source_table,
	dm.sink_dataset,
	dm.sink_database,
	dm.sink_schema,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.sink_schema), CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.sink_schema)), LEN(dm.sink_schema))) AS sink_directory,
    REVERSE(SUBSTRING(REVERSE(dm.source_schema),0, CHARINDEX('/', REVERSE(dm.source_schema)))) AS sink_prefix,
	dm.sink_table,
	rs.filter_alias,
	rs.filter_value
FROM
	sources_and_filters rs
	JOIN @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')} dm
	CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(dm.masked_status) kc
	ON (
		rs.dataset = dm.source_dataset AND
		rs.specified_database = dm.source_database AND
		rs.specified_schema = dm.source_schema AND
		rs.identified_table = dm.source_table
	)
WHERE
	dm.sink_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SINK_CONTAINER}'
    AND dm.sink_schema LIKE '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SINK_DIRECTORY}/%'
	AND (dm.mapping_complete IS NULL OR dm.mapping_complete = 0)
	AND ISJSON(dm.masked_status) = 1
	AND kc.[key] = rs.filter_alias
    AND kc.[value] = 'false'
	AND	(
		(filter_alias = 'default' AND  
			identified_table IN (
				SELECT DISTINCT
					identified_table
			FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d
				CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
			WHERE
				ISJSON(assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
				AND JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.alias') = 'default'
			)
		)
		OR
		(filter_alias != 'default')
	)

SELECT TOP 1 metadata
FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
WHERE dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'

text.value:
WITH
    tables_requiring_filters AS (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table
        FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
        WHERE ISJSON(assigned_algorithm) = 1
            AND dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
            AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CONTAINER}'
            AND specified_schema LIKE '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_DIRECTORY}/%'
    ), all_filters AS (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            JSON_VALUE(kc.value, '$.alias') as filter_alias,
            identified_table
        FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')} d
            CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(d.assigned_algorithm) kc
        WHERE
            ISJSON(assigned_algorithm,ARRAY) = 1
            AND
            identified_table in (
                SELECT identified_table FROM tables_requiring_filters
            )
    ), sources_and_filters AS (
        SELECT
            dataset,
            specified_database,
            specified_schema,
            tables_requiring_filters.identified_table,
            JSON_OBJECTAGG(filter_alias:CAST(0 as BIT)) AS masked_status
        FROM tables_requiring_filters
            INNER JOIN all_filters
            ON tables_requiring_filters.identified_table = all_filters.identified_table
        GROUP BY dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, tables_requiring_filters.identified_table
    )
    UPDATE @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')}
    SET masked_status = sf.masked_status
    FROM sources_and_filters sf
    INNER JOIN @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_SOURCE_TO_SINK_MAPPING_TABLE')} dm ON
        dm.source_dataset = sf.dataset AND
        dm.source_database = sf.specified_database AND
        dm.source_schema = sf.specified_schema AND
        dm.source_table = sf.identified_table
    WHERE
        dm.masked_status IS NULL
        AND (dm.mapping_complete IS NULL OR dm.mapping_complete = 0)

sinks.name: MaskingParameterOutput
sinks.description: Sink results of computing masking parameters to activity output cache

transformations.name: FilterToSingleTable
transformations.description: Filter ruleset table down to the table in question by specifying dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table, and assigned_algorithm - making sure they match the dataset associated with each version of the dataflow, DF_SOURCE_DATABASE, DF_SOURCE_SCHEMA, DF_SOURCE_TABLE, and not empty or null (respectively). This filters the ruleset down to only the rules that need to be applied for masking this particular table

transformations.name: RulesetWithTypes
transformations.description: Join the ruleset table with the type mapping table based on the type of the column and the translation of that type to an ADF type

transformations.name: RulesetWithAlgorithmTypeMapping
transformations.description:
Generate several columns:

    output_row that always contains 1 (used later for Aggregate and Join operations)
    adf_type_conversion that contains a string like <column_name> as <adf_type>
    column_width_estimate that contains an integer that uses DF_COLUMN_WIDTH_ESTIMATE as the width for any column where identified_column_max_length is not positive, and identified_column_max_length plus some padding otherwise

transformations.name: GenerateMaskParameters
transformations.description:
Grouped by output_row produce the following aggregates

    FieldAlgorithmAssignments - a JSON string that maps a column name to its assigned algorithm
    ColumnsToMask - a list of the column names that have an algorithm assigned
    DataFactoryTypeMapping - a string that can be used by ADF to parse the output of a call to the Delphix masking endpoint, leveraging the adf_type_conversion column derived previously
    NumberOfBatches - an integer value determined by computing the number of batches leveraging the max row_count as specified in the ruleset table, and the sum of column_width_estimate column derived previously
    TrimLengths - a list of the actual widths of the columns so that will be used by the masking data flow to trim output before sinking

transformations.name: ModifyNumberOfBatches
transformations.description: Modifies the number of batches to be at least 1

transformations.name: FilterAdlsType
transformations.description: Filter type mapping table down to only the dataset in question

transformations.name: ParseMetadata
transformations.description: Parse the content from the metadata column that contains JSON, specifically handling parsing of known keys (i.e. date_format)

transformations.name: DateFormatHeader
transformations.description: Create DateFormatAssignment, grouped by output_row (which is always 1), generating a JSON string that maps a column to its specified date format

transformations.name: DateFormatString
transformations.description: Derive columns as necessary for handling the parsed data (i.e. consume parsed_metadata.date_format and put it in a column date_format_string), and add an output_row column that always contains 1 (used later for Aggregate and Join operations)

transformations.name: AllMaskingParameters
transformations.description: Perform an inner join on output_row with the computed DateFormatHeaders - combining all masking parameters into the same output stream

transformations.name: RemoveUnnecessaryColumns
transformations.description: Remove intermediate columns

transformations.name: SplitOnDateFormat
transformations.description:
Split the data into two streams, data that contains a specified date
format, and data that does not

transformations.name: NoFormatHeader
transformations.description: Create NoFormatHeader, that generates a JSON string containing an empty map when all values are null, grouped by output_row (which is always 1)

transformations.name: JoinDateHeaders
transformations.description: Full outer join both DateFormatHeader and NoFormatHeader where output_row = output_row

transformations.name: DateFormatHeaderHandlingNulls
transformations.description: Update column DateFormatAssignments to coalesce DateFormatAssignments, and NoFormatHeader (i.e. if DateFormatAssignments is null, take NoFormatHeader, which won't be null), similarly with output_row

transformations.description: Create column DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_SORT_ID that consists of SHA of the data across all columns in the table - every row will have this value and it cannot be null

transformations.name: SortBySortKey
transformations.description: Sort the table by the value in DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_SORT_ID, as we need the table to be in a particular order before we apply a surrogate key

transformations.name: CreateSurrogateKey
transformations.description: Add a DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID column that increments by 1 and starts at 1 after applying the sorting

transformations.name: WrapValuesInArray
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, convert the value into an array, this is needed to preserve null values as null when using collect, as null values become []

transformations.name: SelectColumnsUnmasked
transformations.description: Select only columns that don't require masking

transformations.name: AggregateColumnsByBatch
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, aggregate to a list using collect, grouped by DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID batches by using DF_TARGET_BATCH_SIZE and the number of columns being masked, name the group as DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_GROUP

transformations.name: FlattenValuesOutOfArray
transformations.description: For each column we wish to mask, flatten the value out of the array, in the case where the value was previously [], it becomes null

transformations.name: AssertNoFailures
transformations.description: Confirm that we received a 200 response status from the API request

transformations.name: FlattenAggregateData
transformations.description: Unroll the API response body into named columns

transformations.name: JoinMaskedAndUnmaskedData
transformations.description: Inner join on SelectColumnsUnmasked and FlattenAggregateData based on matching DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID

transformations.name: TrimMaskedStrings
transformations.description: For each column with a string type, trim the string to length based on the value in DF_TRIM_LENGTHS - this is needed as masking a string may produce a longer string that exceeds the column width in the sink

transformations.name: CreateSinkFileName
transformations.description: Create column DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_SINK_FILE_NAME by replacing DF_SOURCE_DIRECTORY with DF_SINK_DIRECTORY in the value in DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_FILE_NAME

transformations.name: CreateAlterRow
transformations.description: Add an alter row condition so that all rows will be inserted into the existing table with the correct column order

transformations.name: CombineRows
transformations.description: Union the output of RemoveAmbiguousColumn with the empty CreateAlterRow table, and performing the union by name

transformations.name: RemoveAmbiguousColumn
transformations.description: Since both FlattenAggregateData and SelectColumnsUnmasked have a column DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID, we need to remove that column, so select all columns whose name isn't DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID

transformations.name: RemoveAllData
transformations.description: To preserve the order of the columns, we will remove all rows from the table by filtering on false()

properties.description: Generate masking parameters when conditional algorithms are defined

sources.name: Ruleset
sources.description: Get the ruleset table from the metadata store at DF_METADATA_SCHEMA.DF_METADATA_RULESET_TABLE

sources.name: TypeMapping
sources.description: Get the type mapping table from the metadata store at DF_METADATA_STORE.DF_METADATA_ADF_TYPE_MAPPING_TABLE

sinks.name: MaskingParameterOutput
sinks.description: Sink results of computing masking parameters to activity output cache

transformations.name: FilterToSingleTable
transformations.description: Filter ruleset table down to the table in question by specifying dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, identified_table, and assigned_algorithm - making sure they match the dataset associated with each version of the dataflow, DF_SOURCE_DATABASE, DF_SOURCE_SCHEMA, DF_SOURCE_TABLE, and not empty or null (respectively). This filters the ruleset down to only the rules that need to be applied for masking this particular table

transformations.name: RulesetWithTypes
transformations.description: Join the ruleset table with the type mapping table based on the type of the column and the translation of that type to an ADF type

transformations.name: RulesetWithAlgorithmTypeMapping
transformations.description:
Generate several columns:

    output_row that always contains 1 (used later for Aggregate and Join operations)
    adf_type_conversion that contains a string like <column_name> as <adf_type>
    column_width_estimate that contains an integer that uses DF_COLUMN_WIDTH_ESTIMATE as the width for any column where identified_column_max_length is not positive, and identified_column_max_length plus some padding otherwise

transformations.name: GenerateMaskParameters
transformations.description:
Grouped by output_row produce the following aggregates

    FieldAlgorithmAssignments - a JSON string that maps a column name to its assigned algorithm
    ColumnsToMask - a list of the column names that have an algorithm assigned
    DataFactoryTypeMapping - a string that can be used by ADF to parse the output of a call to the Delphix masking endpoint, leveraging the adf_type_conversion column derived previously
    NumberOfBatches - an integer value determined by computing the number of batches leveraging the max row_count as specified in the ruleset table, and the sum of column_width_estimate column derived previously
    TrimLengths - a list of the actual widths of the columns so that will be used by the masking data flow to trim output before sinking

transformations.name: ModifyNumberOfBatches
transformations.description: Modifies the number of batches to be at least 1

transformations.name: FilterToDataSourceType
transformations.description: Filter type mapping table down to only the dataset in question

transformations.name: ParseMetadata
transformations.description: Parse the content from the metadata column that contains JSON, specifically handling parsing of known keys (i.e. date_format)

transformations.name: DateFormatHeader
transformations.description: Create DateFormatAssignment, grouped by output_row (which is always 1), generating a JSON string that maps a column to its specified date format

transformations.name: DateFormatString
transformations.description: Derive columns as necessary for handling the parsed data (i.e. consume parsed_metadata.date_format and put it in a column date_format_string), and add an output_row column that always contains 1 (used later for Aggregate and Join operations)

transformations.name: AllMaskingParameters
transformations.description: Perform an inner join on output_row with the computed DateFormatHeaders - combining all masking parameters into the same output stream

transformations.name: RemoveUnnecessaryColumns
transformations.description: Remove intermediate columns

transformations.name: SplitOnDateFormat
transformations.description:
Split the data into two streams, data that contains a specified date
format, and data that does not

transformations.name: NoFormatHeader
transformations.description: Create NoFormatHeader, that generates a JSON string containing an empty map when all values are null, grouped by output_row (which is always 1)

transformations.name: JoinDateHeaders
transformations.description: Full outer join both DateFormatHeader and NoFormatHeader where output_row = output_row

transformations.name: DateFormatHeaderHandlingNulls
transformations.description: Update column DateFormatAssignments to coalesce DateFormatAssignments, and NoFormatHeader (i.e. if DateFormatAssignments is null, take NoFormatHeader, which won't be null), similarly with output_row

transformations.name: HandleConditionalAlgorithms
transformations.description: Conditionally distributing the data in assigned_algorithm groups, based on the type of data in assigned_algorithm

transformations.name: SimplifySimpleRulesetTable
transformations.description: Simplify the columns of the ruleset table for algorithms that are always applied

transformations.name: ParseAlgorithm
transformations.description: Parse conditional algorithm assignment

transformations.name: FlattenAlgorithmAssignments
transformations.description: Unroll the conditions from the conditional algorithm assignment

transformations.name: ParseKeyColumn
transformations.description: Parse key column conditions

transformations.name: FlattenKeyConditions
transformations.description: Unroll the aliases and conditions from the key column

transformations.name: JoinConditionalAlgorithms
transformations.description: Join the key column, its conditions, and the algorithms assigned to those conditions

transformations.name: FilterToConditionKey
transformations.description: Filter out rows that don't apply to this condition key, and rows that don't include an assigned algorithm

transformations.name: SimplifyConditionalRulesetTable
transformations.description: Rename columns in the conditional ruleset table to match the simplified ruleset table

transformations.name: UnionAllRules
transformations.description: Combining rows from conditional and non-conditional ruleset tables

transformations.name: FlattenConditionalFormatting
transformations.description: Unroll the conditions from the conditional date_format assignment

transformations.name: FilterUnmatchingAlias
transformations.description: Filter down to only this filer alias, as necessary

scriptLines: DataFactoryTypeMapping = concat("'", '(timestamp as date, status as string, message as string, trace_id as string, items as (DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_BATCH_ID as long, ',

conditions as (alias as string, algorithm as string)[]),
